title: CertianlyT appreciation thread
body:
Just want to shout out to CertianlyT that you are super creative. Don't let the board hate bring you down.  As much as I hate playing against champs you designed,  I still love your designs.  They are so unique and different.  I love playing WW.  I don't play a lot of yasuwin because I don't have the mechanical skill, but his playstyle to me fits his theme. Instead of attacking head on, the dashes, weaving in and out of fights makes me feel like fighting as the wind.  

Please keep up the awesome work!!! And don't let the board hate stop you.

I got nothing against CertainlyT as a person, but he lets his creative vision rush ahead of healthy design. Yes, his designs ARE creative, but there's an issue with creativity: without someone to pull him back to Planet Earth, we end up with {{champion:429}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:142}} instead of his more grounded work like {{champion:19}} .

Are CertainlyT's champions fun to play? Sure, but playing AGAINST them is a different story. They are unfun slogfests to fight that rely more on the player screwing up than it does the opponent playing better. Yasuo has Wind Wall, Zoe has her Sleep Bubble and crazy bouncing "skill"shot, and Kalista is a mistake that should be deleted from the game. They have to be kept numerically low-ish to account for how much is in their kit, making them either OP or mediocre, depending on how their numbers are and if their items are really good.

You know what also was _"creative"_?

https://www.geek.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/vsm.jpg

I too, do not hate the man, and I applaud his attempts at innovation. However, I will say some of his designs rely a little too hard on gimmicks to function, and more often than not, he gets carried away just adding in a whole bunch of things that shouldn't be added in, or oversimplifying some parts of the kit (Zoe R) so that he can distribute the power into another part of the kit at a much higher capacity (Zoe Q). He needs to follow the words of Coco Chanel in regards to accessories - Take off the last thing you put on. If he started pruning his kits a little better, and worked a little hard at easing up his power distribution, he'll do fine, and if it take people hovering over him to coax him in that direction (like what happened with Warwick), then by all means, get those people to work with him. I think he just goes way too ham on his own, like the kid who wants to try all the jellybeans in the jars when his mom says he can get a piece of candy, so having some control and boundaries set for him will go a long way towards improving his designs. Sure, thinking and innovating outside the box is the way of progress, but then, so is innovating inside the box, in making existing things more efficient or twisting the rules a little bit that create new twists on things that have been done before.

People have a blast against {{champion:142}} when she's losing.
People are not having fun when they're stomped by a {{champion:161}}.

No champion is universally fun to play against.

Winning is fun.
Losing is not fun.

The only champions that are notably unfun to play against are those that make you feel like you're losing even if you're not, with little you can do to stop that on your own.

CertainlyT's designs don't do that. They're usually reliant on outplaying their lane opponent to gain an advantage early, but are medioce if even and shit from behind.

{{champion:122}} will melt if he doesn't have enough tank items.
{{champion:412}} doesn't survive his own initiations if he's behind.
{{champion:143}} is squishy either way, but if she's behind she won't have the damage to kill her assailants before they kill her.
{{champion:157}} if he's behind, he'll probably hit his 0/11/0 powerspike around the time your nexus falls.
{{champion:429}} is outscaled by pretty much every ADC. Her power lies in her early game, and failing to abuse it will probably lose you the game.
{{champion:142}} may be threatening when ahead, but is nothing more than meat when behind.
